It’s a full upgrade of the model’s skills across coding, computer use, long-context reasoning, agent planning, knowledge work, and design. Sonnet 4.6 also features a 1M token context window in beta. item.author: Job Rietbergen

item.title: Optimized Grok Code Fast 1 is Here (and Free)
item.description: We’re doing something special: Grok Code Fast 1 is back, it’s optimized, and it’s totally free in Kilo for a limited time. We heard you when xAI’s Grok Code Fast 1 model moved to a paid tier. We know it’s a daily driver for many of you.
item.author: Ari

item.title: OpenClaw and the Rise of AI Agents: Power, Promise, and Peril

item.author: neeraj.khandelwal@forgood.ai (Neeraj)

item.title: OpenClaw founder to OpenAI...now what?
item.description: Peter Steinberger, the creator of OpenClaw, is joining OpenAI. Sam Altman announced it on X: Peter will “drive the next generation of personal agents,” and OpenClaw will “live in a foundation as an open source project that OpenAI will continue to support.” Let me say this clearly: Peter earned this.
item.author: Brendan O'Leary

item.title: 16, 2026AnnouncementsAnthropic opens Bengaluru office and announces new partnerships across India
item.description: India is the second-largest market for Claude.ai, home to a developer community doing some of the most technically intense AI work we see anywhere. Nearly half of Claude usage in India comprises computer and mathematical tasks: building applications, modernizing systems, and shipping production soft
item.author: Unknown

item.title: How I Claw - OpenClaw as my Intern
item.description: Everyone’s excited about OpenClaw. The security implications are real. People are buying Mac minis to run it, giving an autonomous agent unfiltered access to their accounts, SSH keys, passwords — their whole life. OpenClaw’s value does come from accessing your email, calendar, and messages. But I th
item.author: Brendan O'Leary

item.title: How to Use NVIDIA NIM + Kilo Code to Access Kimi K2.5 and Dozens of Free Models
item.description: Did you know: NVIDIA has a generous free tier that allows you to use models like Kimi K2.5 at no cost. In this tutorial, we’ll walk through how to use NVIDIA’s Build platform + Kilo Code to get free access to Kimi K2.5. Install the Kilo Code extension Sign up for an NVIDIA Build account.
item.author: Darko

item.author: Ranjith Ramakrishnan

item.author: Unknown

item.title: Custom Kernels for All from Codex and Claude
item.description: tl;dr: We built an agent skill that teaches coding agents how to write production CUDA kernels. Then we pointed Claude and Codex at two real targets: a diffusers pipeline and a transformers model. The agents produced working kernels for both, with correct PyTorch bindings and benchmarks, end to end.
item.author: Unknown

item.title: MiniMax M2.5 is Here, and it's Free in Kilo for a Week
item.description: We started Kilo Code with a simple mission: give every developer the world’s most powerful tools without the “frontier tax.” Today, we’re taking our biggest leap yet. We are thrilled to announce that MiniMax’s hotly anticipated new model, MiniMax M2.5 is live on Kilo Code.
item.author: Ari

item.author: Darko

item.title: Kilo Code Weekly Product Roundup | Feb 11, 2025
item.description: Welcome back to the weekly product roundup! This week, Opus 4.6 lands across the platform, Agent Manager gets YOLO mode and inline renaming, Code Reviews gets a loading UX boost, and we pick up a handful of new models and providers. Anthropic’s new flagship model is live in Kilo.
item.author: Brian Turcotte

item.author: Unknown

item.title: AnnouncementsClaude is a space to thinkWe’ve made a choice: Claude will remain ad-free. We explain why advertising incentives are incompatible with a
item.description: There are many good places for advertising. A conversation with Claude is not one of them. Advertising drives competition, helps people discover new products, and allows services like email and social media to be offered for free. item.author: Unknown
